"
Oh my country, Finland, my country of birth, rings, word golden! No valley, no hill, no water to love the beach, as the homeland of this north, land dear fathers!
Is poor in our country, so we stay, if gold mines Its a guest, yes, an abandoner, but for us the most expensive country is this, its islands, islands, continents, those of us are golden.
Let us love you we touch it with froth, the hum of the eternal glory, our stars, summers bright, with all the pictures and songs mi sank into my heart.
Here Auro, swords, thoughtful our fathers fought, as the day lay in the clouds or shone with luck, here are the most difficult of the Finnish people they were afflicted.
The struggles of this people who can they tell you who? When the war in our valleys rings, and the frost famine brought, who measured that charmer and the suffering of it?
This is where its blood flowed for our good, has enjoyed this joy and sighed his sorrows the people to whom I was ancient our load on the pledge.
The feeling of being here is unmatched and all the best, though luck what comes the land of the fatherland we have it. Mi in the world is kinder and what's more expensive?
And here, here is this country, that is what our eyes see. we can reach out and the water shows the beach and say, is that what it is, the land Our dear father.
If we were to shine albeit in gold clouds, that would not cry, but the most joyful soul would receive, to this poor home however we want.
The home of truth, poetry land of a thousand lakes miss' protection of our lives, a land of memories, a land of hope, just being happy happiness, free and happy.
Sun in its bloom from its shell for once, still our loves are getting up your wish, joy in its splendor, and once, my country of birth sang a higher echo can be obtained. "
